import React from 'react'; const InterviewGuidance = () => { return (

Interview Guidance

{/* Introduction */}

3 Key Takeaways

  • Have a Strong Introduction: A great intro sets a positive tone.
  • Tell Your Worth: Highlight your achievements and contributions.
  • Answer Questions Confidently: Practice makes perfect!

Preparation goes beyond your resume. Learn strategies to boost confidence throughout the process—before, during, and after the interview.

{/* Tip Sections */}

Before the Interview (7 Tips)

  • Research the Company and Role: Understand mission, culture, and responsibilities.
  • Prepare Your Success Stories: Use the STAR (Situation, Task, Action, Result) format.
  • Know Your Resume: Be ready to explain each point clearly.
  • Plan Your Attire: Dress professionally and match the company culture.
  • Logistical Planning: Confirm location or virtual setup ahead of time.
  • Develop Thoughtful Questions: Ask about culture, role expectations, and growth.
  • Practice Responses: Rehearse answers to common questions for confidence.

During the Interview (10 Tips)

  • Greet confidently and smile warmly.
  • Speak clearly and stay focused.
  • Listen actively and respond meaningfully.
  • Use STAR method for structured answers.
  • Showcase soft skills like teamwork and adaptability.
  • Be authentic and professional.
  • Control nerves with breathing techniques.
  • Clarify questions if unsure.
  • Maintain good posture and eye contact.
  • Frame challenges as learning opportunities.

After the Interview (4 Tips)

  • Ask final questions to show interest.
  • Send a thank-you note within 24 hours.
  • Reflect on what went well and areas to improve.
  • Follow up professionally to reaffirm your interest.
{/* Additional Highlights */}

Pro Tips & Insights

  • Dress according to company culture—check LinkedIn profiles.
  • Smile genuinely and use positive body language.
  • Ask smart questions like “How do you measure success in this role?”
  • Be real and let your personality show professionally.
  • Use your soft skills and provide real examples.
  • Stay calm during tough situations—breathe and focus.
  • End interviews by thanking and expressing enthusiasm.

Common First Impression Questions

  • Describe yourself in three words.
  • What do people first notice about you?
  • How do you introduce yourself professionally?
  • Tell a story where you made a great impression.
  • What makes a strong first impression?
{/* Conclusion */}

Final Thought

A great first impression can be the difference between getting hired or overlooked.

Be prepared, be confident, and most importantly—be yourself. Good luck!

); }; export default InterviewGuidance;
